The CVE growth era was good. Together with @MITREcorp and the CVE Board, weâ€™ve built CVE into a federated force, going from:

The CVE Program is the backbone of global cyber defense. It helps us speak a common language about vulnerabilities, and weâ€™re proud to support it AND participate in it.

3 â€” KernelSU Exploits

 Full control of your phone â€” handed to hackers.

âš™ï¸ Attackers could exploit flaws in KernelSU to take complete control of rooted Android devices. With the right malicious app, they can access everything â€” no trace left.

CISA just flagged 3 new actively exploited flawsâ€”two in Citrix Session Recording, one in Git.

The Git bug (CVE-2025-48384) can let attackers run arbitrary code just by cloning a repo. Proof-of-concept exploit is already out.

On Windows, attackers can mount the full C:\ drive, read sensitive files, even escalate to admin. macOS saferâ€”but not safe.

Patch now (v4.44.3). Details â†’ https://t.co/6tQ7FURbFp
